reviews.review_msg: Overall, Dr. Bains did a great job BISC 305, even though there was a lot of content to cover. The student learning objectives were an asset, and made it easier to study for quizzes, the midterm and final (class averages were typically 70-75%). Even having the practice questions in lecture and tutorial helped me understand the material.

Although there was a lot of content covered in the course, Dr. B. did a great job. The SLOs (objectives) and assignments made it easier for myself and my friends to study the material. Textbook was not needed since the lecture notes were clear. Also, Dr. B. is super understanding, and is willing to assist students with their questions.

Despite going over exams in tutorials, I still had no idea why I lost marks on various questions. None of the feedback I received on my exams improved my understanding and just left me frustrated. The way the exams were set up felt like a trivia game that you can't win rather than a test of your understanding of the concepts taught.

Dr Rintoul was an amazing prof! 205 is a super content heavy course, but he made it a lot easier on us, slides are very simple to understand and he explains everything very well! Literally enjoyed taking this course with him so much, I'm taking his neurobiology course next sem!

Gordon was an excellent professor to have during the switch to online because of Covid. He is very clear in what he expects you to know for exams. His lectures are easy to follow and the tutorial assignment was interesting. From the way he communicates, you can tell he genuinely cares about his students. Wish I couldve taken this course in person!

great prof, hosts many office hours, is very available. Midterms reflected material learned in class, made concepts clear. Not enough good things to say about Gordon. Final was a little tricky but is no way unfair. Listens well to feedback, you can tell he's there to help and wants to see success in his students.

Dr. Rintoul was fantastic, and did everything he could to make online learning as painless as possible for his students. His lectures are very clear and down to the point, and he lets you know exactly what you will be tested on. I highly recommend taking a class with him!

Gordon was a great prof because he was very clear with what he wanted you to know for the midterms and even with online classes during covid he gave us 6 additional office hours the week of each midterm which really helped for last minute questions.

Gord is a great prof! He's very clear about his expectations going into exams. The exams themselves were fair and it wasn't hard to do well. Gord is very approachable and helpful. He held tons of office hours, especially before exams. He seems to really care about his students and wanted them to understand the material and do well in his course.

Gord is such a straightforward lecturer. He lets you know what will be important concepts for exams and records all of his lectures so you can listen at home as well. Before the midterms and the final he had office hours every day for a week so he is very accessible for extra help.

honestly, one of the most caring profs i've ever had. really wants his students to do well and takes his time to explain concepts clearly and precisely. going to take another of his courses just because he's that good!!!
Amazing professor and very caring!

Love this proff. he may be my favorite biology proff. He will tell you whats on the exam and what you shouldnt waste you time studying, and he is extremely accesible outside of lectures and will make sure you understand everything. he genuinely cares and wants you to do well

Took the class due to his high rating, and I see why he received it. Excellent lecturer if you can pay attention in class. Studying is based on lecture slides, but they are often too poor to study from if you don't take notes in class. Huge amount of material, but little of it is on the exam, so attending class is a must to protect your grades.

Overall enjoyed this class a lot, Gordon throws a ton of material at you but he tells you what the important concepts are, and spends more time on these.  If he says something is important or it's probably going to be on the exam then it definitely is going to be on the exam.  Focus on that and you'll do fine.
Best Prof. ever!!! Prepares you well for the exams, lectures are not mandatory but extremely helpful. Notes are sufficient to study.
Awesome prof! By far my favorite class this semester. His exams aren't easy and there's alot of material but if you prepare you'll be fine. No tricks.

He was a good lecturer.  He spoke clearly and seemed fairly interested in the course material, however, it was highly favouring neurobiology because that is his field of interest.    The exams were a little tricky with some biochemical pathway multiple choice questions.  The final was great with a choice as to which questions you answered.

Didn't go to class at all just listened to the recordings. His notes have like 3 sentences on them per slide so write down everything he says. He explains this really well. Understand whats going on and the midterm for animals will be so easy. Write a lot om the midterm, be as detailed as possible to get full marks. He's great

Julian was a great prof, if you pay attention to how he describes the way to approach his exam questions you'll be fine. He is a bit picky so there is lots to know but the way he teaches the material gives you a good base to build from for the rest of your undergrad courses. Highly recommend!

11/10 guy very lean, brings green towel in to lecture and says it's brown (he's colourblind) but v cool guy real nice, lectures recorded (video and audio) DO NOT NEED TO ATTEND @ all, but maybe show up for midterms?? & final

His lectures were very interesting and his analogies made concepts much clearer. His midterms were fair but he marks VERY HARD. You MUST be EXTREMELY specific or you'll lose marks. The final was tricky. He would put in alternate terms of familiar things to trick you (e.g. instead of hemoglobin like in all his slides, it'll be respiratory pigments)
Definitely need to attend lectures, but overall good class. Marking is fair and he tries to make everything interesting and relevant!

Julian is a pretty good professor all around He is a nice guy and lectures very clearly. The tests can be challenging but are fair and relevant to the lectures. If you do not go to lecture you will probably do poorly as he uses the overhead to draw lots of figures that are not provided elsewhere. this is the prof to take this course with. Not inigo

Julian is a great prof. He really cares about the class as a whole doing well on his exams! If you go to class and take good notes, you'll be set for his exams. Just be careful with your wording as he is quite a picky marker. However, I still ended up with an A+ so his marking obviously wasn't too picky :P Highly recommend!

A great prof!! He makes the course really interesting. I had a lot of fun taking his bisc305 course. He draws diagrams in the lecture, so it's a good idea to attend his lectures although it's not mandatory. Exams were fair and fun! I remember there was a question about X-man :))
Great prof! Just listen to his lectures and you will be fine.  No textbook, so you only need to study your notes.

Fantastic prof - very friendly and helpful! Loved the lectures - very entertaining and great at getting information across in a way that makes it easy to retain.  I can't believe how much I  learned from this course (so much different from just memorizing a ton of facts and then forgetting them). Yea, he's pretty easy on the eyes too :-)

Awesome, young, fun! You don't need a textbook for his class ($$ saved), he's laid back and slightly dorky, but he makes class interesting. Exams are fair. I waited till summer semester to take 305 with him cuz that's the only time he teaches that course...definitely worth the wait.

He went over the materials in class very slowly (about 12 slides per lecture), and the materials were easy to understand. But the exams were marked quite hard. Figures are not included in the notes, so if you need figures, you must buy the text book. Only one midterm though, so lots to know for midterm and final.

He is a great guy. you have to go to lecture cause his notes are skeleton notes.  His exam was fair, I found it easy, but some did poorly, but it was only short and long answer..it was based on the extra stuff he talked about in lecture.  If you go to lec then don't read the text.  doesn't pronounce things right though, can be irritating. nice guy!
nice smile, good class

You may want a tutor on the side... she just reads off lecture slides, and doesn't explain things too well... she'll tell u don't read the textbook! Honestly, read it! It will save your life. This is for BISC101
You may want a tutor on the side... she just reads off lecture slides, and doesn't explain things too well... she'll tell u don't read the textbook! Honestly, read it! It will save your life

Shes awful. Wish she would just give the complete slides and let us actually listen and understand the material in class. When students do listen and ask a question, she does not have the knowledge to answer it a lot of the times. She reads off her own laptop notes because even she cant memorize it all. Expect us to memorize a dictionary for exams.

So she was pretty bad. She did not know the material, it came straight out of the text. So if you wanted more info, she couldn't really answer it. She didn't tell you what to focus on, so you literally studied every detail. Her marking was brutal too; looked for specific words and terms even if you had the idea down.

Worst prof I've had in university. Notes were constantly changining and eventually we got stacks of fill in the blank notes which made it impossible to listen. Midterms were okay but marked strangely & feedback was ambiguous. (Never went over midterm answers in tutorials.) Also gave a term paper which is unheard of for this course. Avoid this prof.

Nice prof and pretty clear and helpful if you ask for it. She gives you a lot of detail in her answers and provides a lot of feedback. There's lots to memorize so over all but material isn't difficult. However she's REALLY nit picky about spelling and exact terms and phrases on exams. She destroyed people on the term papers, TA was more generous.

compared to other 305 profs she's one who focuses  barely at all on physics, a definite plus.  I would compare the information load to an MBB class though - a lot of memorization and very dry.  She is a good lecturer in that she shares slides, recordings, pages from the textbook, and writes notes as she goes.  only downside  tonne of information

Her first midterm was way too hard and basically the rest of the semester was trying to make it up because she wouldn't scale it. The other midterm and the final weren't too bad but there was no way to make up for the first midterm for most people. It was also hard to read her; she wasn't very clear on which topics were likely to be on tests.
V. clear in lecture.  Midterms and exams straightforward, so just study the lecture notes.  Always cheerful and v. approachable.
